intro: Platystemon californicus var. sphaerocarpus, commonly known as the California flatstem, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its flat, branched stems. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and inland scrub habitats. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native range.
